meanings.definition: The flat cutting part of a knife or tool
meanings.sent1: She carefully sharpened the blades of her scissors.
meanings.sent2: The chef used the blades of the knife to chop vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The blades of the lawnmower were so sharp they could slice through grass like butter.
meanings.sent4: His words were as cutting as the blades of a knife.
meanings.sent5: The blades gleamed in the sunlight, ready for any cutting task.

meanings.definition: The flat, wide part of an oar
meanings.sent1: The rower dipped the blades of the oars into the water.
meanings.sent2: The blades of the oar helped propel the boat forward.
meanings.sent3: The blades of the oar splashed water playfully as they moved through the lake.
meanings.sent4: The blades of the oar sliced through the calm water with ease.
meanings.sent5: The blades of the oar glistened with each stroke against the water.

meanings.definition: The rotating part of a wind turbine
meanings.sent1: The blades of the wind turbine spun gracefully in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The energy was generated as the blades of the turbine rotated.
meanings.sent3: The blades of the wind turbine hummed a soothing tune as they turned.
meanings.sent4: The blades of the wind turbine danced in the breeze, harnessing power.
meanings.sent5: The blades of the wind turbine sliced through the air, capturing energy.

meanings.definition: The sharp edges of a sword or knife
meanings.sent1: The warrior's sword gleamed with deadly blades.
meanings.sent2: The blades of the knife were honed to perfection.
meanings.sent3: The blades of the sword whispered a sharp song as they cut through the air.
meanings.sent4: The blades of the knife were as swift as a striking snake.
meanings.sent5: The blades of the sword left a trail of sparks in their wake.
